Description: Locally rather abundant shrub to 1 m tall with generally several decumbent to erect main stems arising from at or near soil surface, secondary stems generally whorled, spines thinner than those of nearby C. echinocarpa, white, individuals occurring only on areas of dark gray schist and not on nearby granite outcroppings, n=33 during meiosis of microgametogenesis, chromosome determination made 27 March 2012 from live material potted in sand
Single shrub with this morphology; heavily infested with off-white insect larvae; stems processed in sunlight.
Shrub to 1.8 meters tall. Flower: tepals dull red; filaments pink with white base, style white, stigma white.
Cloning shrub in wash; flowers orange-yellow turning red-orange; fruit red with blood-red pulp.
Flowers orange-bronze suffused with purple; one plant; pollen stain = 74.8%

Densely branched shrub 4dm tall, 7dm broad; spines red-brown with translucent-white tops; sheaths translucent-white, tinged tan toward apex; flowers yellow, tinged variously green, purple-red, and brown-orange; filaments pale-green below, pale purple-red above; style cream-white; stigma pale green; fruit spineless or with at least 2 persistent spines, leathery, tuberculate, ca. yellow-green, orange-red toward apex, especially about the areoles, both putative parents occur within 30m; seeds per fruit: 3, 3, 2, 7, 20, 0, 3, 1, 19
Clumps 35 - 50 cm in diameter; spines golden to brown, erect, rigid.
Shrub 1.2m tall, as broad, rooted along wash; stems spreading to erect; fruit clavate, smooth, yellow to red
Large cactus

Planta erecta con tronco definido, 1.20 cm de alto, 1 m ancho, ramas ascendentes, epidermis glabra; segmentos langeolados, el apice Redondo, 12-16 cm largo, 4-6 cm de ancho, gruesos, verde obscuro; areolas elipticas 3-4 mm largo, 2-3 mm ancho, lana café claro; gloquidasausentes a escazas. Espinas 0-1, subuladas. Flores anaranjadas rotadas, 6-8 cm de diametro. Cultivada como ornamental en frete de casa,
Cultivated in tree and in greenhouse. Fruit bright pink-red.
Decumbent. 1620 m Flowers pink, anthers cream-white, filaments suffused with pink above, style white, stigma light green.

Plantas escasas cientos de individuos; los tallos terminales desprendiendo fácilamente formando nuevos clones; las vainas doradas iluminadas en el sol, asi que las plantas formando parches dorados en el paisaje; frutos verdes a amarillentos, estériles y aveces formando cadenas, aveces con espinas gloquidoidios (i.e. caducos)

Flowers purple; flower buds collected in meiosis 13 June 2005 after remaining dormant for several weeks; individual in cultivation at Chino Valley, Arizona; stems and flowers collected 2005; n=11 during meiosis of microgametogenesis from same cultivated individual.
3-8 m tall, straight-trunked, often flat-topped branches often horizontal and +- whorled. Dense dark green leave cover, showy orange flower. Inner tepals orange, filaments very pale pink
form Socos
Frequent, often many headed, growing up against rocks, plants with large tap roots.

Shrub 1-2 m tall: fruit abundant, not chaining, light yellow-green; spines light straw-colored; flowers pale purple-red, tepals erect, thickened, stigma and anthers cream-white; fruits falling and forming new plants; leaves 2-3 mm long in dry area and 10-12 mm long in wet areas.

Plant height ca 40 cm; stems globose, blue-gray-green; spines black or dark gray or gray, long ca 43-104 mm, reflexed; flowers collected in the afternoon, diameter 40-76 mm, length 56-65, outer perianth white with a green midstripe, inner perianth with with a pinkish midstripe, spines on flowers, nectar glands present; stigma lobe number 5, white; style white; filaments white at top and green at base.

Small shrubs, thousands of plants throughout barren forming, in some cases, giant clumps to 40 cm high, and up to 8 or more cladodes deep, from the action of disarticulating cladodes, tuberous rooted, fruit red, inner tepals entirely yellow and stigmas light green (flowered in cultivation), 2n=44.

Locally common. Trees (6?) to 9 or 10 m tall; branched from 1 to 1.5 m about ground with moderate secondary branching but crown not crowded. Flowering branches slightly longer-spined and narrower than sterile branches. Faint white annual growth-marks on the dark green surfaces of some stems. Flowers and fruits are from the distal 1 to 4 dm of the stems. Fruit not eaten by the residents, green and fuzzy outside, pure white inside; floral remnant persistent. Bruises and cut surfaces redden immediately and blacken in minutes. Pith and cortex firm and not visibly mucilaginous.
Plants 5-10 cm tall, 5-15 cm in diameter, branches erect, purplish. Fruit dark purple when ripe.
Infrequent shrub but at least four individuals locally.
Pitaya.
Planta trepadora de 4 m con flores amarilla y frutos verdes.

Rare, one plant, ca 1 m tall, much branched, growing amongst tamarix, fruits deeply tuberculate, green becoming yellow towards top with maturity, fruits 30(l)x20(w) mm, 36x18 mm, 40x16 mm, 38x22 mm, 38x20 mm, 37x19 mm. Flowers collected 17, 21, 23 April 2009 late afternoon by Joni Ward, Andrew Salywon and Wendy Hodgson: flowers 52, 56-58, 63 mm long, 45, 48, 49, 54 mm diameter, outer perianth wine colored to pink with reddish green midstripe, inner perianth pink to wine colored with green at base and tan-pink margins, filaments chartreuse green becoming pink-magenta distally, anthers yellow, style cream-white, stigma lobes yellow, 5, 7, 8; ovary (hypanthium/pericarp) dark green, large, thick and succulent, drying quickly; fruit collected 17 April 2009, dry, tan, 30(l)x18(w) mm, 22x16 mm, appearing sterile.
4 m tall, branching at one-third from base; flowers whitish; mature fruit dark purple-green to light green.

Frequent trailing shrub generally less than 0.5m tall; near type localities for O. macrocentra Engelmann var. martiniana L. Benson. and O. superbospina Griffiths; flowers golden yellow, inner tepals with pale beet-color along midrib, stigma pale green, Style very pale green, abruptly truncated (see also Baker 16782, 16783, 16788, 16798, 16798.2, 16925, 16926, 16927; individuals transplanted to outside garden, Chino Valley, Arizona.

shrubs, .30 - .40 m tall, 1.0 -1.5 m in diameter; branches prostrated with 3-7 stem segments.  Pads orbicular, 12-16 (-21( cm in diameter, 1-1.5 cm thick glabrous, gray-green.  Paristachies 10-13, the areoles 1-1.7 cm apart.  Areoles elliptical to round, 3.5-4.5 mm long, 2.5-3.5mm wide; wool white aging dark gray, in lower half of areole.  Glochids yellow to redish aging dark brown, 2-4 mm long, in apical tuft and a few surrounding the wool. Spines acicular, 0-3 (-4) present in upper third and edge of pads, .5-1.5 (-2) cm long, initially redish turning gray with age, central spines erect; 0-1; radial spines 0-4 ascendent to depressed. Flower: 6-6.5 mm long, dark orange to red; pericarp 4.3 -4.5 cm long, 2-2.3 cm in diameter, light green, tubercled; areoles elliptical, 2.3-3 mm long, the glochids reddish, in apical bundle, 3-5 mm long; outer tepals linear to triangular, 10-21 mm long, 4-6 mm wide, bright red, entire, the apex acute; inner tepals broadly lanceolete, 20-5 mm long, 8-9 mm
15 ribs.
Ca. 1m tall

1 large sprawling shrub to 50 cm tall, spines yellow turning white with age, no fruit seen, some cladodes affected by Cactoblastis cactorum; flowers yellow, fruit purple (flowered and fruited in cultivation), 2n=55 (Majure et al. 2012).
Shrub to 2 m tall, several "individuals" locally; n = 33/2 during meiosis of microgametogenesis from bud collected in the field
Perennial to 10cm. Stem ovoid. Corolla pink-magenta.
Suculenta, diámetro de 5.75, longitud 6 cm; espinas 1-3 centrales, la dominante hacia abajo, 10-13 radiales, con flor reminiscente, fruto de campo.

Plantas bianuales, de 15 cm de altura. Cuadrante de estudio Los Gomez. 16 plantas etiquetadas en Agosto de 1999 solo 8 plantas aun contaban con etiquetas; varias etiquetas fueron encontradas arrancadas y tiradas en el suelo, por lo que no se pudo continuar con la medición de plantas presentes. Varias plantas nuevas se encontraron dentro del cuadrante que no habian sido detectadas antes.

Shrub-sized cactus, 1.5 m; stems 4-angled, grayish; 4 open flowers and 20 buds; tepals white. Flowers partially open at 3:15 p.m. in shade of ridgeline, fully open by 4:30 p.m. and visited by honeybees.

Rare, growing under Parthenium against limestone rock, with milky sap, 15 mm above ground, 85 mm total height, 110 mm wide, tubercles dark green, flower (one observed) 17 mm high x 18 mm wide, inner tepal 11 mm long x 2.5 mm wide, oblanceolate, outer and inner tepals cream with pink-green midstripe, filaments light cream basal 1/2, light pink distal 1/2, anthers cream, style light pink, stigma lobes 8, light green, fruit 12.5 mm long x 8.5 mm wide, 24x9.5 mm, 18x8.5 mm, 19x9 mm, 20x9 mm, pinkish-red to red, juicy, seeds red-brown(?).
Flores brancas.

Infrutescence prostrate; flowers dark violet to dark blue-violet; dense shrub 4 dm tall; 1 m broad, stems gray-green, spines pale red-brown, sheaths very pale red-brown, dark toward tip; flower buds not open yet, generally less mature than O. whipplei buds nearby, fruit generally green, sometimes yellow; 1 plant seen. n=11 from microsporogenesis; 10 fruit w/0 seeds, 1 w/2, 1 w3, 1w/4, 1w/8.
Locally very common pebble cactus on Báucarit Formation volcanic mudflow barrens . Maximum density: 64-165 heads/m3 (4 plots), heads: 3-16 mm diam. (av. 7.7 mm, n=100); 1-5/plant (23 heads/7 plants).

Originally collected by Joselyn Fenstermacher 2215 9 January 2007, SW of turnoff [to Solis], low, gravel hill north of higher hill, just above small drainage bed, probably gypsiferous soil; material planted in greenhouse pot, Chino Valley, Arizona; somewhat ill-scented; flower photographed and collected 1 August 2015, style damaged, pollen-fertile; another flower photographed and collected 8 August 2015, filaments pale green below, yellow midway, and pale purple-red above; flower collected 26 July 2016 and another 31 July 2016; bud collected during meiosis of microgametogenesis 31 July 2016; flower collected 1 August 2016 and another 6 August 2016; n=22 during meiosis of microgametogenesis.
extirpated

Plantas cespitosas, de 30 cm de diametro por 10 cm de alto; segmentos del tallo cilindricos, obovados, 3-4 cm de largo, desprendióles, verde obscuro a grisáceo, formando cadenas hasta de 8 segmentos, reptantes; tubérculos 1-1.5 cm de largo por 0.5 cm de alto; areolas elipticas 3-4 mm x 3 mm; lana blanca pasando a grisacea; gloquidas numerosas dispuestas en la mitad superior de la areola, amarillentas, hasta de 6 mm de largo en ápice de segmentos; vaina papiracea en la punta de espinas; espinas aciculadas con base triangular, asperas, rigidas hasta 4.5 cm de largo, 1 central y hasta 12 radiales; fruto claviforme, 2.5 cm de largo x 1.2 cm de diámetro; areolas con gloquidas cortas.
Scattered clumps

Flower diameter 24-30 mm, length 20-24 mm, stigma number 7-8, stigma color light green, outer perianth color white with pale brownish-purple mid-stripe, inner perianth color white with brownish-purple mid-stripe; style color pink; nectar clear and viscous; milky, sticky sap present upon flower collection.
Perennial with red tinged yellow flowers; 4-5 colonies seen.
Flowers green-yellow, filaments yellow; spines white, suffused with red-brown, especially toward base; sheaths translucent white
form  cephalophora  subs. Neoporteria

Arborescente, 3.5 m de altura, segmentos bovados, glabros, delgados. Espinas blancas, aciculares, base aplanada, el ápice ambar. Flores amarillas, 2.5 cm largo, 3 cm ancho en anthesis; estilo blanco amarillento, stigma verde claro, lobulos 5; filamentos blanquecino-amarillento, thygmotropicos; antheras amarillas, 1.5 mm long. Frutos amarillentos, esteriles.
Frequent among gravel where Larrea is abundant.
Locally abundant (32 in my path per hour of slow searching).

Cuerpo globoso, hasta 10 cm de alto, con 10 costillas, flores rosadas, drutos rosados, aovados; mayormente juvenilies aqui, los adultos estan sacados para vendor por usus medicinales; vimos restos de un especimen pelado (d9nde habian quitado las espinas y parte de las raices).
Common. Plants climbing over rocks, prostrate to slightly ascending to 20 cm tall, none seen in flower, cladodes easily disarticulating.
form  villicumensis  subs. Pyrrhocactus

Frequent, erect-sprawling, flowers 40(l) x 40(w) mm, 46x45 mm, 40x43 mm, 36x40 mm, perianth orange-red-rust red, filaments yellow-maroon-cream, anthers yellow, style very light green to cream white, stigma lobes 8, light green.

Arbustos, 1.0-1.30 m del alto, 1.5 m de ancho; cladodios oblongos a anchamente obovados, 16-25 cm de largo, 12-14 cm de ancho, verde grisaceos, el apice agudo; areolas dispuestas en 6-7 series espiraladas, distantes 3-4 cm; areolas elipticas a circulares, espinas blancas a grises, subuladas, 0-3, 1-3.5 cm de largo.  Flores anaranjadas, 8 cm de largo, 6 cm de ancho; pericarpelo elongado, verde obscuro, glabro, con 4 series de areolas.  Areolas circulares, con lana blanca.  Tepalos externos deltoides, verde obscuro; tepalos internos naranja, 4-4.5 cm de largo, 2.5 cm de ancho; filamentos amarillos, 1-1.2 cm de largo, anteras amarillo claro, 2.5mm de largo, estilo anaranjado, 1.5 cm de largo; estigma amarillento, 5-6 mm de largo.
Miles de indivs. con 11-13 costillas, muchos ramificando desde el cefalio, los tépalos rosados, frutos blancos a rosado-morados.
Frequent to occasional shrub, 2/3 m tall x 2/3 m wide, flowers yellow, old, spine, sheaths tan with hint of pink; plant suggestive of some C. acanthocarpa introgression.
Decumbent to erect, branching usually from near base, stem dark green, spines gray, fruit dark green, seeds black, no flowers.
Fls bright lemon yellow, faint salmon base, yellow filaments; style white, stigmas bright dark green.
Local shrub with mostly prostrate to decumbent stems.
Plants occasional, small, single.

Single stem with 5 main branches with sub-branching, height 13 cm, diameter 20 cm; stems gray-green with some browning; spines lighty gray with black or dark brown tips; flowers collected mid-afternoon, diameter 46-54 mm, length 35-38 mm, outer perianth cream with a wide, dark pink midstripe, inner perianth cream with pale pink midstripe; stigma lobe number 9-10, cream or pale yellow; style hot pink; filaments cream, some filaments tight around style, others against inner perianth; sweet nectar.
Ample plants.

Plant height 8 inches, globose; stem gray-green, rib count 13, crest of stem has a short protrusion covered in white wooly spines and reddish-brown spines; spines tan or amber or pale reddish-brown with darker tips, one erect spine; flowers collected in the afternoon, diameter 16 mm, length 20-21 mm, outer perianth pale hot pink, inner perianth hot pink; stigma lobe number 6, white; style pale pink or white; filaments very pale yellow; fruits fleshy, ovoid, red at tops, hot pink at base, diameter 9 mm, length 20-22 mm; seeds black.
Cuerpo cespitoso, tallos cilindricos de aprox. 3 cm de largo y 2 cm diám.
Occasional here, on top of ridge, single stemmed but branched above, spines and sheaths silver; plants seemingly stressed by dry conditions.

8 stems in clump, ribs 13-15, spines triangular or quadrangular, gray with darker tips (brownish); flowers 54(l)x44(w) mm, 48x45 mm, outer perianth reddish brown tip with green or yellow base, lower perianth are bract-like, inner perianth yellow with a few with reddish tips, filaments light yellow, anthers yellow, style cream-yellow, stigma yellow, 11, 12; soft wooly spines at base of ovary.

población grande con adultos y bastante juveniles, tallo 15 x 12 cm, con 11 costillas, cefalio 2 x 5 cm, botones y flores viejas con los tépalos rosados, fruto 19 x 8 mm, rosado, clavado; muchos indvs, en población con múltiples tallos por daños del cefalio. Representa población de M. nagyi Mészáros.
árbol hasta 6 m de alto, su cópula hasta 8 m de ancho, frutos maduros verdes, 10.5 x 9 cm, cayendose al piso al madurar
Occasional milky sap. Milk.
Solitary mounded (40 mm high, 115 mm diameter) cactus with 15 heads (21-32 mm diameter) in rocky, reddish soil.
Perennial to 10cm. Stem ovoid. Corolla pink-magenta.

Epiphytic climber, horned tip, plant height 1 meter; stem grey-green or blue-grey-green, rib count 3; spineless or with very minute spines less than 4 per aerole, spines grey to dark grey; flower collected in the morning, diameter 15 cm, length 25 cm, outer perianth green with red or red-violet at edges, middle white with pale pink midstripe, inner perianth white, flower was closed and had bloomed overnight, nectar gum on outer perianth lips; stigma lobe number 25, white or cream; style white or cream; filaments white.
Cuerpo simple, globoso, de hasta 15 cm de diám. Frutos maduros.
Tree to 1.5 m tall; trunk heavily spined.
Globular plant, 5 cm tall; areoles whitish, aligned along plant ribs; spines cinnamon colored, fairly dense, spreading; FLowers 4 cm loong, petals lemon yellow
Plant 1.5 m high; flowers orange with purple-red on the outside, style white, stamens cream, fruits green.
Multi-stemmed cactus on steep ravine side, short spines, many ribs
Few plants
Clump of low spreading cactus stems, these more or less sphaerical

Arbustos rasteros formando grandes colonias debajo del bosque seco abierto, todos estériles; con escamas duras y algunas aparentemente previamente atacado por Cactoblastis cactorum como en O. dillenii por la zona; plantas con aparencia de un cruce entre O. dillenii y O. taylorii.
Uncommon arborescent Platyopuntia, 4.5 m high, with a single trunk 15 cm DBH, branches in upper half of plant. FIs. yellow fading to peach pink; stigmas light green, style white; stamens yellow.
Plants locally abundant but probably cloning; shrubs to 3 m tall forming dense thickets; flowers red, but usually not opening.

Stems oblong, about 10 cm. tall and 5.5 cm. thick, 13-ribbed; areola with 13-20 radial spines, these 1 cm. long and white; upper areolae with one central spine, 15 mm. long or more, reddish-brown throughout or at the tip; in bloom.

Stens dark green, decumbent, to 1 m tall, spines dark brown when young, light gray with age, the newer spines with light green bases, flowers orange-red, slightly irregular, stigma pale green, stamens grouped above stigna, anthers red-purple, fruit green with a purple apex.
ample plants
Possibly lloydii; would need more material to be sure; lloydii solitary; formosa often forming large clusters with 2-4 centrals, 0-several radials. Sap milky, flower from different plant.
Flower Color Data: 2741B (2B) Tepals: yellow; Filaments: yellow to golden; Anthers: very pale yellow/cream; Style & stigma: white. Approx. flowering dates: 13-21 May.
Large cactus
Solitary cactus at base of Ipomoea arborescens.
Occasional fragile 'choya' under shrubs; tepals light yellow, outer lower tepals green in middle, filaments light green, stamens pale yellow, stigma and style white.

árboles hasta 10 m de alto, 16 individuos grandes vistos aquí, troncos con grande diámetro muchas veces formando grupos de largas espinas de las areolas, tallos con tres costillas; flores viejas secas, ningún fruto presente (fruto amarillo como vista en fotos de T. Clase de las mismas plantas); conocido como Sansón.
flowers magenta with white center, stamens orange, stigma olive green.

Abundante aquí, ca 2.5-3 m de alto formando un tronco principal y ramicando arriba, tronco bien aramado de areólas espinosas, ramas con 9-10 costillas, frutos amarillos (50-74 x 49-65 mm), pulpa blanca, grosor del pericarpelo 1.2-2 mm.

Localized, inconspicuous. Stem surface appearing pale grayish olive (somehow different from typical var. fissuratus, which might appear more blackish leaf-green under the dusty cuticle). No reproductive structures except some seeds buried in the apical wool. Specimen consists of one healthy plant sacrificed at time of collection, plus a cuticular skeleton (illustrating variation in tubercle size/surface and areole shape). Approaching var. fissuratus.
TOPOTYPE of O. deserti
Frequent on ridge.
Cactus tree 6.5 inches tall. Fruit green to pinkish red. Fruit: some pink on spines. Flower: creamy brown. Branches long and twisting, aging brown.
Outer perianth yellow with darker midstripe, inner perianth yellow; other flowers collected 19 May 1993; no other collection data.
Mat-forming perennial to 1 dm tall, 1 m broad, mostly in shade but often in full sun; young spines dark gray-brown to red-brown.
Plant 3'4'. It was stated that all plants growing at this location were all apparently stunted.

1m tall, 1.5m broad, stems yellow-green, spines widely spreading, very pale yellow-brown, ca. darker toward base; note one flower with double style and two locules, anthers cream -yellow, stigma green, inner tepals yellow, tinged orange toward base. sheet 1 of 2.
Cuerpo simple o cespitoso, tallo aplanado de hasta 8 cm de diám. Con látex. Con frutos maduros.
Arbusto craso de 3 a 4 m, flores blancas, frutos inmaduros,
Tepals with purplish-red midvein area, filaments red, anther yellow, stigma yellow upper and red lower.
Simple de 2.5 m. Cladodios ovoides de 30 cm.
Flowers pale yellow.

n=11 during meiosis of microgametogenesis, May 1999, from an individual transplanted to Chino Valley, Arizona; flowers (2) photographed and collected 25 May 2010 from individual transplanted to Chino Valley, Arizona.

Population of numerous individuals, which continues to the top of Black Mountain (2150m [5900']) and onto the north-facing slope; see also Baker 14306, 17880; flowers photographed and collected 22 April 2015 from stems potted in garden, Chino Valley, Arizona; additional flowers collected 24 April and 7 May 2015; potted stems died by May 2016.
Flowers collected on 12 Jun 1973. Perianth off-white; stigmas light-green.
Plantas bajas, cespitosas, 6-12 cm de altura, 30-5-cm diametro; tallos redondos, 1.2-2 cm de diametro, tuberculados; areolas circulares, 4-5 mm de diametro, con lana color crema; sin espinas.
Candelabra to 2 m tall, stem dark green, spines gray, flowers erect or ascending, petals dark pink, anthers yellow, stigmas light green, fruit bronze-green.
Flowers diam 15-21 mm, length 19-24 mm; stigma # 6-7, pale yellow or cream; outer perianth burgundy or reddish brown with cream edges, inner perianth cream with burgundy or pink midstripe
Planta epifita, ramas 1 m de largo, cilindricas; 8- 12 mm de diámetro; costillas 8; areolas alargadas con espinas cortas y delgadas, adpresas. Común.
Flowers white.
form truncatipetalus
Rare.
Fruit red/purple.
Cactu con 12 costillas, cefalio rojizo ca 30 cm de largo, flores rosadas, frutos rosados, semillas negras.

Stems many, stout, 1-1.25 m tall, hypanthium green, petals bright yellow, ovary, style and stigma cream-white, filaments and anthers yellow, fruits round, spiny, and juicy, gathered by locals who scrape spines off and sell or eat the fruits, mature fruits round, to 13 cm in diameter, very juicy, sweet and delicious, seeds numerous, tiny, black, embedded in clearish pulp. Fruits with stem and photo of fruits, flowers off different plant in some population, other photos of different plant in same population.
Flowers yellow
Rare to a.5 m tall.
Caespitose low-growing with tepals budding yellow, turning solid iridescent orange at anthesis, and aging light reddish; frequent locally.
Magenta fls. The dried flower, as of May 1994. remains brightly colored, tepals rose magenta inside, paler and less colorful outside.
Epífito, hojas carnosas, flores lilas, frutos verdes.
Hierba, epifita colgante; fruto verde-blanco, abayado.
Single very local population.

Plantas globosas, solitarias o fornnando colonias; tallos 8 cm en diametro; espinas 1 central rojiza, 6 mm largo; espinas radiales 6-7, aciculares, blancas; flores amarillas con margen de tépalos blanquecinos.
Shrub to 1.5m tall, along railroad tracks; stems green; flowers orange-red.
Cuerpo simple, aplanado de 20 cm de diám. Con botones florales.
Petaloids and outer sepals white pink mid-stripe, filament pink, anthus yellow, style pale green, stigma lobes green.
sterile shrub to 1 m tall, stems with 5-6 ribs
Plant height ca. 3 ft, diameter 12-16 in.
Rare.

Flower photographed and pressed 23 February 2009 from individual transplanted into greenhouse, Chino Valley, Arizona; another flower photographed and pressed 24 February 2010, the flower had been open for several days; dead stems collected 11 July 2013.
Tepals mostly red with some yellow coloration.
Partially tuberous root.

Plant cultivated in greenhouse, multi-stemmed mound (21), height 9 inches, width 13 inches, individual stems columnar, green, rib count 10-12; radial spines dark brown and graying with age, central spines dark brown, graying with maturity; flowers collected late morning, diameter 36-37 mm, length 35-38 mm, outer periath pale red with wide dark red mid-stripe, inner perianth pale red with dark red mid-stripe; stigma lobe number 8-10, white; style cream with light pink at tip; filaments white.
Flowers yellow. Tepals yellow.

Shrub generally 1-2 m tall from 1 toseveral trunks to 9 cm diameter, these generally suberect; main branches arching-ascending; ultimate stem segments whorled, very easily detached; fruit yellow to pale green-yellow, leathery, moderately tuberculate, somewhat wrinkled.

Plant height ca 3 feet; joints blue-greay-green; spines white, tuberculate; areoles appear grayish-purple; flowers collected in the afternoon, diameter 25-35 mm, length 30-33 cm, outer perianth magenta with brownish midstripe, inner perianth bright magenta; stigma lobe number 5, pale yellow; style pink; Plant is dead.
13-ribbed stem.
n=11, meiosis irregular
Pith very wide; medullary vascular system obvious; very woody, the root especially woody.
form  neohankeana
Frequent shrub ca 2-1/4 m tall x 2.5 m wide.
Tree to 2.5 m, clear yellow flowers.
Locally abundant
Locally common only; clump-forming, low-growing (one joint high)
Locally abundant.

Plant with milky sap. Flowers with outer tepals pink-brown and inner tepals cream with pink midstripe; perianth to 1.5 cm long; filaments white, anthers yellow, style cream, stigma lt. Green with 5 short lobes; Chromosomes n=11

Original name given to speciment (Echinopsis uebelmannian) not formally published. Plants 45 - 60 cm tall, 30 - 40 cm in diameter, 34 ribs; spines golden, 7 - 8 centreal, 14 - 17 radial spines, 3 - 8 (-14) cm long.
Ample plants.
Common.

Generally solitary stemmed but at least two individuals with two stems; large spines dark brown, some individuals with uniformly straw-colored spines, ca. 40 adults seen, no juveniles, ca. 12 dead individuals.

Plantas arborescentes, epidermis pubescente; segmentos del tallo anchamente obovados; 27 x 17 x 1.2 cm; 15 series de areolas, distantes entre si 1.4-2.0 cm; areolas circulares de 2.5 mm; lana blanca en el centro; gloquidas cafe claro dispuestas en semicírculo en la parte apical, 3 mm de largo; espinas delgadas, amarillentas, 3-8 con algunos pelos setosos, amarillos; frutos obovados, amarillentos, carnosos.
Shrub to 2 m tall; fruit ovate, pale yellow-green to orange-red, chaining.
Flowers red.
Small, inconspicuous cacti, not infrequent here, with large root.

Locally numerous individuals; stems trailing. This is not the type locality for the species. Stem transplanted to pot, Chino Valley, Arizona. Bud collected in late meiosis of microgametogenesis at 18:30 hrs, 23 May 2013, n = 55/2, stem collected 2 June 2013.
